Yeah, I don't think there's a way to avoid the extra memory usage right now.

It's probably worth updating AssignOp to have an attr option that allows broadcasting, matching XLA's broadcasting semantics. Then the initializer can use a scalar constant.

I'll mark this as contributions welcome.

body:
Yeah, I don't think there's a way to avoid the extra memory usage right now.

It's probably worth updating AssignOp to have an attr option that allows broadcasting, matching [XLA's broadcasting semantics](https://www.tensorflow.org/performance/xla/broadcasting). Then the initializer can use a scalar constant.

I'll mark this as contributions welcome.
